thread.title: Bend Whitewater Park opens to flood of paddlers (photos, video)
thread.title_full: Bend Whitewater Park opens to flood of paddlers (photos, video) | OregonLive.com

author: Thomas Boyd | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Bend Whitewater Park opens to flood of paddlers (photos, video)
text:
Bend Whitewater Park Jeff Frank owner/operator Tumalo Creek Kayak and Canoe in Bend, Oregon, talks about the Bend Whitewater Park. The Bend Whitewater Park gets heavy use from paddlers even as park and trail construction continue into the Summer of 2016. The paddle trail sits just downstream of the the Old Mill District, which is a popular shopping and dining spot that offers access to the Deschutes River Trail and the river itself. The dam it replaced was impassable, and paddlers had pull out above or portage around to continue. The project creates three channels below the dam — a gentle waterway for tubers and stand-up paddle (SUP) boarders, a protected section for fish and wildlife habitat and a white water wave play area.
